results.title: Editing a film: Synge's 'The Well of the saints'
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Larry Yust
results.brief_description: The principles involved in editing a film are explained, using the film version of John M. Synge’s play “THE WELL OF THE SAINTS”. The role of the editor in film production, and the purpose and result of editing, are described, and both proper and improper techniques are illustrated
results.title_for_label: Editing a film: Synge’s ‘The Well of the saints’

results.title: Edith Piaf
results.creator_credit: Triangle Productions, Theodora Olembert and Peter Graham
results.brief_description: A documentary on the life of the famous French singer. Highlights the pressures undergone by entertainers, such as the constant travel, drugs and alcohol and media attention. Narrated by Alan Badel

results.title: Edith Head
results.creator_credit: Blackwood Productions, Sokal-Kerr Productions, Christian Blackwood and Charlotte Kerr
results.brief_description: An interview with multi-award winning costume designer Edith Head in which she discusses her career and presents some of the costumes she has designed for Hollywood legends including Mae West, Jean Harlow, Ginger Rogers, Dorothy Lamour, Paul Newman and Robert Redford. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Edinburgh Festival, 1962
results.brief_description: A kaleidoscope of varied aspects of the international festival of music including art exhibitions, a display of athletics and dancing at Murrayfield, and views of the floodlit Military Tattoo.

results.title: Edge of the outback
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Stefan Sargent
results.brief_description: A picture of the life in the region of Longreach, Queensland, at the time of the annual Agricultural Show in a drought season. Without explicit commentary we candidly observe a grazier and his family over several days while they go about their family, business and social life

results.title: Edge of the deep
results.creator_credit: Boolari Films, Peter Bruce and David Corke
results.brief_description: The film illustrates the way of life on the sea shore. Many birds such as gulls, pelicans, swans and cormorants are shown and their adaptations to the tidal pattern explained. Migratory and breeding habits of other species are discussed. This poetic film of bird life is centred round two derelict barges which locate the scene and establish the continuity of the movements of the tide.

results.title: Edge of darkness. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: Into the Shadows - His investigation into his daughter’s murder reveals to Ronald Craven her involvement in nuclear power, politics, terrorism and death. Despite the agonies of his grief, Cravan finds himself drawn into Emma’s secret world. Rated: M
